reviews.text: Booked on-line because it seemed "ok" and all other hotels were booked. Now I know why nobody books here. Rooms were filthy, smelly and humid. Slept fully clothed and with my hoody cause it grossed me out so bad. I don't know if they don't have any health inspections in Maine but I'm pretty sure this hotel should be shut down and stripped of their license. Non of our keycards worked, half the plugs didn't work and the tv (probably from the 80s) only had like 8 channels. Unreal, if possbile, save your money and sleep in your car.
reviews.title: Horrible, don't book here

reviews.text: I booked through AARP. The rate advertised on the hotels billboard was considerably lower than what I booked. Front desk manager said the sign was incorrect and he had asked the manager to correct it several times, but no luck! The room across from us in the interior hallway had police tape on the door. Our room was so creepy. The towel rack was hanging off the wall attached by one screw. Bedside lampshade looked like it had been run over by a truck. Ice machine was broken and the bar keep (who the the front desk manager directed me to) said it stayed broken. After no answer to my calls to the front desk for 30 minutes, the manager came to our room and agree that it was pretty bad and that he would get the rate "adjusted" by the manager. It didn't happen. Run don't walk!
reviews.title: Just awful!

reviews.text: This place has NO BUSINESS chargind $130.00 a night for a room with two double beds. While some reviews say it smells HORRIBLE, it really isn't all THAT horrible. Just stale and can tell the rooms were all once smoking rooms. I am a smoker and still noticed it. The couple that went with us had a broken bed and a broken coffee maker. I could tell that while it APPEARED fairly clean, for that money, I did not want to see dust on carpet around furniture, gum candy and dust in ac vents, etc. The lounge? Well its definitely still in 1970's decor, small, dark and got a little awkward later in the evening after we attended the godsmack concert and wanted a beer. Just too OPENLY GAY for me. I have no problem with gay but I don't like to see heterosexual people grinding and humping eachother. The drinks ARE inexpensive!! If you run in real quick and chug you'll be fine. I have also been made aware that all rooms are pet friendly. We all know what THAT means!! Thiats probably why it has a stink about it. I HAVE stayed at worse, but, that was a 13.00 hotel outside of FT. Benning GA. Back in the late 80's. However, I wouldn't plan another stay at this HOJOS! Ever! Unless it truly was $45.00. Then, it would be worth it.
reviews.title: Only stayed because there were no other rooms available.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: dirty, no smoking was very smoked in, no towels,no coffee,& no ice
reviews.title: THE WORST

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The place was fully booked BUTTTT The bed,sqeaky,worn out, we rolled to the middle. I asked for more pillows and was told there were none. The pillow cases, like gauze.,Our room had no coffee.I asked for some it couldn't be found. Ice machine broken for two days . Phone cord missing, towels scratchy.
reviews.title: bad place in 44 characters +/-

reviews.text: Booked rooms for myself, mother & father and sister and brother n law to stay at one night because my niece was graduating form UMO. We had a very long day were tired. Walked into the lobby and it smelled so bad like cat urine. My mothers checked out her room she stated it was OK.
reviews.title: DO NOT STAY HERE!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I went into our room the floor was dirty, the hotel smelled. There was puke and hair on the floor! Lifted the blankets your could tell the sheets were not changed, 3 long black hairs on the pillow, looked like pubic hairs in the sheets. The towels were folded but, you could tell they were used. My sister came knocking on my door, she found a buger on her pillow and some excrement on the side of the bed. Because Of graduation all hotels were pretty booked. We decided to go look for rooms next door at the other hotels....NO rooms! I did not want to stay here but, had no choice. We decided we would go to the bar for a drink. Found out that is a gay bar. I have nothing against gays....but this kind of establishment should not be connected to a hotel.
reviews.title: Very run down. Will not stay here again.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Went back to the room, found more hairs and goo in the bed. I went to the front desk, looked at 3 other rooms that the clerk said cancelled... It was just as nasty""". I decided I was not going to stay there, and so was my sister. My parents are older and my mom said she had no hairs in her bed.
reviews.title: STAINED SHEETS.. DIRTY

reviews.text: We called super 8 down the road and they happened to have 2 non-smoking rooms. Thank GOD!
reviews.title: Will not return

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Felt bad leaving my parents in the filth! DO NOT STAY HERE! THATS ALL I CAN SAY!
reviews.title: Just... Don't.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I would give this place a 'average' rating if it was considered a 'budget' hotel....but for $75 a night I expected more.
reviews.title: Hotel is your typical 'budget hotel'

reviews.text: Hallway smells narly.....REALLY narly. Room was slightly better than a motel 6....BUT a motel 6 is much cleaner than this place.
reviews.title: Do Stay Here!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There was mold on the ceiling of the bathroom.
reviews.title: Disgusting stay away.

reviews.text: If you can get this place for $45-50 its worth it. For $75...nah. But then again it might be the going price in the area....I didn't go to other hotels in the area to check it out.
reviews.title: Very disappointed!

reviews.text: I am writing this review from the hotel using their internet service. First thing our keys didnt work. Pool cant be used and from a post from July 1 it was out of service then. We leave come back to the room and the tv doesnt work. They change us rooms and we get another. The ice machine, soda machines are all out of order. Does anything work here??????? Do yourself a favor stay somewhere else, anywhere...
reviews.title: OLDER HOTEL

reviews.text: We stayed here Prior to vacation as they offered a park and fly. First of all, they have no shuttle service like many of the neighboring hotels. They also charge 20.00 to park there so depending on how long you are traveling there is no savings compared to parking at airport....not to mention the staff there are sketchy to say the least...they require you leave your keys behind for your vehicle - not something I was comfortable doing. Our room was very overpriced for what we got. 90.00 to stay in a dump. The beds were made, but poorly done. The only good thing it had going was at least the sheets were clean! The pillows were old and had long passed their time...should have been thrown out 20 years ago.The carpet in the room was nasty and I'm certain had not been vacuumed in the last month if not year. The bathroom had mold on the ceiling above the shower and the shower curtain was stained. We had asked for additional towels as there were only 2 in the room. We had to ask 3 times to receive towels that have probably been around since they opened 50 years ago. They were very thin and one had a hole in it. On top of everything the hotel and room had a very musty smell.
reviews.title: Disgusting! Waste of money.

reviews.text: They also advertise free wifi...and this I believe meant NO wifi...I could not get a signal in the hotel anywhere!
reviews.title: you get what you pay for

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I am not a picky traveler but I do require clean accommodations. This hotel is definitely outdated and very poorly maintained. I would not recommend this hotel to my worst enemy to stay at. All in all it was a very disappointing experience for it being a name like Howard Johnson!
reviews.title: Hit or Miss

reviews.text: most of the hotels in the area are $100-$200 so when you find a room for $50, it's $50 for a reason. I've stayed here a few times. The cleaning staff needs to all be fired. They dont do anything. I've seen questionable white goop, pubes in the tub, mold, grime, rotten food crumbs, blood stains, and god only knows what else. I've seen sex acts and drug use go on in the hallways (which smell like a homeless guys asscrack by the way) The front desk is often run by extremely rude young kids. if you can, bring your own sheets and towels, i'm not sure if the drug addicted cleaning staff ever wash them. It's an okay place to stay if you're drunk and need a place to sleep it off. It is NOT a family friendly hotel. Often times, you'll reserve the room online for $50, and when you go to check in, it's $70 or more. When I plan on staying at hojos, I pack a kit with my own bedding and lots of lysol. It's basically a hotel for the patrons of the gay bar. (if you attend the bar, and people know you have a room... they will try to get you to 'invite' them up)
reviews.title: Bait and switch

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I recently stayed at this hotel while our son was a patient at EMMC. As stated on other reviews the hotel is dated and needs a major overhaul. However, we found that Room #205 to be somewhat acceptable. It seemed newer and cleaner than others we have had. There was a microwave and a mini fridge and free wi-fi. Our last visit was a brief stopover en route to Boston and we were assigned room #206. That room should not be rented out. Nasty but we stayed anyway being that it was for one night only. We never had any problems with front desk or staff. We would probably stay here again but pre-request #205.
reviews.title: Tournament Weekend
